title: Gaten Matarazzo of Stranger Things set to host his own frightmare show, Prank Encounters, on Netflix
text:
He's used to scary situations as the co-star of Stranger Things.

Now Gaten Matarazzo has his own frightmare reality show, Prank Encounters, on Netflix.

The streaming service describes it as 'monstrous frights meet hilarious reveals on this hidden-camera prank show as real people become the stars of their own full-blown horror movie.'

He's seen Stranger Things: Gaten Matarazzo hosts new Netflix frightmare reality show, Prank Encounters, in which unwitting people find themselves in scary situations - until he turns up to save them

And the first terrifying trailer - that's also hilariously funny - dropped on Thursday.

In each episode the 17-year-old brings seemingly supernatural situations to life, shocking complete strangers and taking them by surprise.

'If I were you I probably wouldn’t trust anyone this Halloween season… especially me!!,' the teen tweeted Thursday.

'Are you ready to scream and laugh with me when #PrankEncounters hits @Netflix on October 25?'

All seems normal: This young woman was hired as a doctor's assistant

Too much for her: She screamed and ran when an arm punched its way out of a man's stomach, Alien style, during a routine operation

Big reveal: The young woman still looked worried even after other actors in the skit laughed

Each episode features guests who believe they've been hired for temp jobs such as babysitting, being a security guard or an assistant.

But things quickly go wrong. In one prank, a walking plush bunny scares the life out of a young woman hired to look after a child.

In another, a woman runs away screaming as an arm punches its way out of a man's stomach, Alien style, during a routine operation.

Toys are too-too much: 'It moved!' the babysitter yelled as one of her young charge's plush bunnies got up and walked

It's all on film: A multitude of hidden cameras record every second of the set up

Hidden cameras record every second of set up and Gaten always turns up to save the day, in one case yelling, 'Guys, guys, I know what's happening. You're on my prank show, Prank Encounters.'

Fortunately, it looked like most people took the prank well after the shock wore off.

Meanwhile, Netflix has renewed Stranger Things for a fourth series. Gaten co-stars in it with Millie Bobby Brown, Finn Wolfhard, Caleb McLaughlin, Noah Schnapp and Winona Ryder.
description: The 17-year-old sets up sets up seemingly supernatural situations for unsuspecting victims in the first terrifying trailer - that's also hilariously funny - that dropped on Thursday.  The show bows on October 25.
